segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to use the BitLocker Recovery Password Viewer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to use the BitLocker Recovery Password Viewer.

segment.source: The BitLocker Recovery Password Viewer tool is an optional tool included with the Remote Server Administration Tools (RSAT).
segment.target: The BitLocker Recovery Password Viewer tool is an optional tool included with the Remote Server Administration Tools (RSAT).

segment.source: It lets you locate and view BitLocker recovery passwords that are stored in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
segment.target: It lets you locate and view BitLocker recovery passwords that are stored in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).

segment.source: You can use this tool to help recover data that is stored on a drive that has been encrypted by using BitLocker.
segment.target: You can use this tool to help recover data that is stored on a drive that has been encrypted by using BitLocker.

segment.source: The BitLocker Active Directory Recovery Password Viewer tool is an extension for the Active Directory Users and Computers Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in.
segment.target: The BitLocker Active Directory Recovery Password Viewer tool is an extension for the Active Directory Users and Computers Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in.

segment.source: Using this tool, you can examine a computer object's Properties dialog box to view the corresponding BitLocker recovery passwords.
segment.target: Using this tool, you can examine a computer object's Properties dialog box to view the corresponding BitLocker recovery passwords.

segment.source: Additionally, you can right-click a domain container and then search for a BitLocker recovery password across all the domains in the Active Directory forest.
segment.target: Additionally, you can right-click a domain container and then search for a BitLocker recovery password across all the domains in the Active Directory forest.

segment.source: You can also search for a password by password identifier (ID).
segment.target: You can also search for a password by password identifier (ID).

segment.source: Before you start
segment.target: Before you start

segment.source: To complete the procedures in this scenario:
segment.target: To complete the procedures in this scenario:

segment.source: You must have domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: You must have domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: Your test computers must be joined to the domain.
segment.target: Your test computers must be joined to the domain.

segment.source: On the test computers, BitLocker must have been turned on after joining the domain.
segment.target: On the test computers, BitLocker must have been turned on after joining the domain.

segment.source: The following procedures describe the most common tasks performed by using the BitLocker Recovery Password Viewer.
segment.target: The following procedures describe the most common tasks performed by using the BitLocker Recovery Password Viewer.

segment.source: To view the recovery passwords for a computer
segment.target: To view the recovery passwords for a computer

segment.source: In Active Directory Users and Computers, locate and then click the container in which the computer is located.
segment.target: In Active Directory Users and Computers, locate and then click the container in which the computer is located.

segment.source: Right-click the computer object, and then click Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the computer object, and then click Properties.

segment.source: In the Properties dialog box, click the BitLocker Recovery tab to view the BitLocker recovery passwords that are associated with the computer.
segment.target: In the Properties dialog box, click the BitLocker Recovery tab to view the BitLocker recovery passwords that are associated with the computer.

segment.source: To copy the recovery passwords for a computer
segment.target: To copy the recovery passwords for a computer

segment.source: Follow the steps in the previous procedure to view the BitLocker recovery passwords.
segment.target: Follow the steps in the previous procedure to view the BitLocker recovery passwords.

segment.source: On the BitLocker Recovery tab of the Properties dialog box, right-click the BitLocker recovery password that you want to copy, and then click Copy Details.
segment.target: On the BitLocker Recovery tab of the Properties dialog box, right-click the BitLocker recovery password that you want to copy, and then click Copy Details.

segment.source: Press CTRL+V to paste the copied text to a destination location, such as a text file or spreadsheet.
segment.target: Press CTRL+V to paste the copied text to a destination location, such as a text file or spreadsheet.

segment.source: To locate a recovery password by using a password ID
segment.target: To locate a recovery password by using a password ID

segment.source: In Active Directory Users and Computers, right-click the domain container, and then click Find BitLocker Recovery Password.
segment.target: In Active Directory Users and Computers, right-click the domain container, and then click Find BitLocker Recovery Password.

segment.source: In the Find BitLocker Recovery Password dialog box, type the first eight characters of the recovery password in the Password ID (first 8 characters) box, and then click Search.
segment.target: In the Find BitLocker Recovery Password dialog box, type the first eight characters of the recovery password in the Password ID (first 8 characters) box, and then click Search.

segment.source: By completing the procedures in this scenario, you have viewed and copied the recovery passwords for a computer and used a password ID to locate a recovery password.
segment.target: By completing the procedures in this scenario, you have viewed and copied the recovery passwords for a computer and used a password ID to locate a recovery password.
